definition: to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: Whales and dolphins rely on their responsive hearing to interpret returning echolocation clicks.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼和海豚靠回声定位系统来辨别方向。

sentences.english: Learn how to discern and develop true friends.
sentences.chinese: 学会辨别真假，交些真正的朋友吧。

sentences.english: I'll let you put your own quotations around the word experts.
sentences.chinese: 我要让你学会自己辨别谁是真专家谁是假的。

sentences.english: He knows good from evil, fight from wrong.
sentences.chinese: 他能识别善恶，辨别是非。

sentences.english: Those who have enrolled in credit-bearing courses offered under CAM will be issued a CAM student identity card.
sentences.chinese: 学分累积制的学员将获发学生证作辨别身份之用。

sentences.english: We should distinguish between right and wrong.
But I won't give up without a fight.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我甚至无法辨别是非。

sentences.english: The near-synonym discrimination plays an important role in English learning.
sentences.chinese: 近义词辨别在英语学习中是不可忽视的重点和难点。

sentences.english: Beauty and sexuality have become so completely intertwined as to be indistinguishable.
sentences.chinese: 现在的所谓美丽与性感往往交织在一起，很难辨别。

sentences.english: A saw-toothed tail and large head distinguish the reclusive Chelydra serpentine, or 'snakelike swamp thing.
sentences.chinese: 锯齿状的尾巴，巨大的头颅，是辨别鳄鱼龟的特征。

sentences.english: According to the model, limen of logarithm loudness is independent of intensity.
sentences.chinese: 这个模型认为，响度对数的辨别阈不随信号强度变化。
伤风使某人失去辨别滋味的能力。

sentences.english: I think I would ask for a compass, which always points north, to help find direction.
sentences.chinese: 我认为需要一个指南针，用以辨别方向。

sentences.english: The musician can discriminate minute variations in tone.
sentences.chinese: 乐师能辨别声调的各种细微变化。

sentences.english: Secondly, scientific scepsis is an effective way to resolve scientific …
sentences.chinese: 再次，科学怀疑是辨别真科学与伪科学的有效方法。

definition: to differentiate/to distinguish/to discriminate/also written 辨別|辨别
to screen/to discriminate/to reexamine a case/screening (of applicants etc)
to differentiate/to draw a distinction/to divide into categories
to distinguish (between different things)/to make distinctions clear
to conclude/to determine/to come to a judgment
